TopicTitle: Hello people, I'm new to Kerbal... any tips on getting started?

Articles.Content: So played small amounts before but never attempted anything extreme and might try and go somewhere on vacation. Where is suggested.

Greetings Kosmo and welcome.

Ask questions when you have them, read other threads here to discover questions and answers you don't have yet, check out the thread below, and haaaave fun.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/58260-Tips-and-tricks-you-found-out-yourself

Welcome to the forums!

You say you've only played a little, but I don't really know what level you are on. Have you reached orbit around Kerbin yet? If you haven't, that could be a good thing to start with. If you have enough fuel left you could even try to crash into the Mun just for giggles!

if you are good at interplanetary transfers, laythe or duna is a good target for great views. but layth is tidaly locked (always has one side facing) to jool, so mack shure you land on the right side. duna is the same, to.
Welcome. Everything you need is in the tutorial in my signature, read until bored then explore your own ideas :-)
